Name: Khao Nom
Description: The definitive place for Thai desserts but their entrees hold up equally well. They also have excellent and unique vegan options.
Recommendations: Spicy Mock Duck, Water Chestnut, Pandan Custard Crepes
First Image Alt: Variety of desserts - including pandan cubes and coconut puddings - on a plate

Name: Thaan
Description: A new and underrated Thai spot. They specialize in meat and seafood but their vegan- and vegetarian-friendly offerings are solid.
Recommendations: Hat Yai [Fried Chicken], Spring Rolls, Pla Plo [Grilled Branzino], all of the curries
First Image Alt: Pile of deep fried shrimp and fries

Name: Stand Alone Cheese
Description: Local purveyor of fine cheese that also sells deli meats and bread.
First Image Alt: Pile of cheeses. Image Credit: Stand Alone Cheese

Name: White Bear
Description: Best spicy wontons in New York hands down, even before you factor in the low price.
First Image Alt: Interior of a spartan restaurant

Name: Il Bambino
Description: You come here for paninis, it's as simple as that. Their menu changes regularly so keep an eye on their Instagram.
First Image Alt: Photo of a panini

Name: Izikaya Fuku
Description: Come here for good Japanese comfort food. In addition to more "traditional" Japanese offerings, they also have some interesting and delicious Western fusion items.
First Image Alt: Photo of the interior decorated with Japanese lanterns and advertisements and a flag on the ceiling.

Name: Cemitas el Tigre
Description: Cemitas are a type of Mexican sandwhich, and this place does them really well. They also have an assortment of other foods and a decent alcohol selection. They do have a veggie cemita and a veggie burrito (with cheese) but the selection isn't big enough to have them ranked as vegetarian friendly. Also, the website is outdated, they have outdoor and indoor seating as of October.
First Image Alt: Portabella mushroom cemita

Name: NetCost Market
Description: This is the lone Queens outpost of a relatively prolific supermarket chain specializing in Eastern European products. They bake fresh bread daily, have a great selection of authentic deli products and stock a variety of imported goods. They also have a Glatt Kosher (albeit pricy) buffet of prepared foods.
Recommendations: Sunflower seed bread, Everything pickled, Goose liver pâté

Name: 969 NYC Coffee
Description: Cozy Japanese café and restaurant selling both fresh items and imported snacks. They also have a private patio dining area in the front.
Recommendations: Onigiri, tonkotsu ramen, chicken tonkatsu sandwich
First Image Alt: Take-out container of yakisoba (fried noodles and vegetables)

Name: Pata Paplean
Description: Conveniently located bar with plenty of physically-distanced seating and unique cocktails
First Image Alt: Covered outdoor seating area lit with string lights, and a sign listing noodles for sale.

Name: Joju
Description: Bahn Mi shop with excellent green tea boba
Recommendations: Bahn Mi with a fried egg, Mango Lychee Green Tea Infusion, "Mojito" drinks
First Image Alt: Bowl of mock beef over white rice with cucumbers, pickled carrots and other delicious pickled mystery veggies.

Name: A+ Roof Bar
Address: 39-16 College Point Boulevard, level R, Flushing, NY 11354
Description: Rooftop bar on top of the Parc Hotel. A+ stands out from the other rooftop bars in the area for its clever cocktails, pleasant ambiance and not-deafening music.
First Image Alt: Photo of four cocktails

Name: Thai Thai Grocery
Description: Cozy Thai grocery that stocks a variety of imports in addition to staples. The owner is also incredibly sweet so get to know her! And take her advice if she recommends an item because it will probably be delicious. Unfortunately the store is not wheelchair accessible because of a small step on the entrance.
Recommendations: palm juice, Thai Lay's, pandan custard
First Image Alt: Photograph of the exterior with two stools and a table on the sidewalk.

Name: The Lemon Ice King Of Corona
Description: Iconic hole-in-the-wall with something like 30 flavors of Italian Ices.
First Image Alt: Photo of a small Italian ice

Name: Fuskahouse
Description: A relative newcomer to the block, their menu bears an uncanny resemblance to the adjacent Tong NYC. That said, they seem to edge out their competitor on quality. They're open in the afternoon and stay open well into the evening.
First Image Alt: Round aluminum takeout container full of fuchka - little orbs with a thin crispy outer layer - arranged around a container of tamarind water.

Name: Unidentified Flying Chickens
Description: Definitive neighborhood spot for Korean Fried Chicken and Beer
Recommendations: Wings Combo, Poutine Fries, Delerium Nocturnum, Hitachino White, Nitro Milk Stout
First Image Alt: Photo of wing and drumstick combo next to poutine

Name: Habiba B&B (Sunnyside)
Description: One of the best carts or trucks for halal food in Queens. They also have a location in Astoria.
First Image Alt: A delicious but partially eater halal platter

Name: The Smokehouse
Description: Classic Jamaican food done well. People have reported mixed experience with the service because of how busy it is, but the food is completely worth a wait.

Name: Louie's Pizza
Description: TODO Neil

Name: Habiba B&B (Steinway)
Description: One of the best carts or trucks for halal food in Queens. They also have a location in Sunnyside.

Name: Milkflower
Description: Great, quiet spot for novel personal pizzas

Name: Temple Canteen
Description: Cafeteria in the basement of a Hindu Temple.

Name: Cannelle Patisserie
Description: An out-of-the-way Italian restaurant with excellent desserts. Also one of the few establishments in our database with customer parking, including accessible parking.

Name: Prontito
Description: Wonderful spot if you're in the mood for gluttonous excess. Contrary to what the name suggests, the service is not at all fast but the items certainly make for an experience. It's also off Roosevelt on a quiet side street so the ambiance is nice.
First Image Alt: An absolutely loaded hot dog with a fork in the container.

Name: Beijing Dumpling
First Image Alt: Plastic take-out container of spicy vegetarian wontons

Name: Hong Kong Taste Cafe
Description: Classing Hong Kong style café that serves breakfast, milk tea and other inexpensive fare.
First Image Alt: Photograph of the storefront with menu posters in the windows

Name: Frangos Peri Peri Queens
Description: TODO Dhru
First Image Alt: Plate of chicken over rice and salad

Name: Xi'an Famous Foods (Flushing)
Description: Flushing location of a small chain. It's offering is very distinct and is a great spot for non-carnivores.

Name: 3 Aunties Thai Market
Description: TODO Dhru

Name: 39 Kings Cafe
Description: The cuisine is nothing to write home about, but it's cost effective and is open well into the night.

Name: NY Go Go Fast Food Inc
Description: Rock bottom prices for good food, right next to the 7 train and the LIRR. You might hate yourself afterwards, but you wallet certainly won't.

Name: New Flushing Bakery
Description: No-frills bakery right outside the subway station. The Portuguese egg custard tarts are to die for though.
Recommendations: Portuguese Egg Custard Tarts, Pineapple buns

Name: Terraza 7
Description: One of the nice places to drink in the immediate area by virtue of not being directly underneath the train - or even on a busy street. The live music is nice plus.

Name: Lamoon
Description: This restaurant is unique it that it unapologetically serves primarily northern Thai dishes. You won't find pad thai here, but if you come with an open mind, you won't be disappointed. They've also pivoted toward serving to-go lunchboxes because their location is not conducive to sidewalk seating.

Name: Dek Sen
Description: TODO Dhru

Name: Taste Good
Description: TODO Dhru

Name: Malay Restaurant Inc.
Description: TODO Maksim

Name: Thai Son
Description: Contrary to what the name suggests, this is the place to go to if you want pho - or Vietnamese food more generally - in Jackson Heights.

Name: Jahn's
Description: Classic American diners are a dying breed in New York City, so this list would be incomplete without Jahn's. It's a wonderful, low-key spot for a meal and/or ice cream if you're not feeling adventurous.

Name: 88 Canteen
Description: An authentic Hong Kong style diner. It's a quirky genre but it grows on you, and it makes for an interesting breakfast experience.

Name: Main Bakhtar Halal Kabab
Address: 6729 Main St, Kew Gardens Hills, NY 11367
Description: Typical middle eastern kebab, just pretty good and relatively cheap. Also a great option for large groups.

Name: Sugar Freak
Description: Solid Cajun/Creole spot in Western Queens, specializing in New Orleans fare.
